dta.TPPlusTransitRoute¶

class dta.TPPlusTransitRoute(net, name)¶

Bases: object

Representation of a transit line read from Cube line file (TRNBUILD or PT)

__init__(net, name)¶

addTransitNode(nodeId, isStop, access, delay)¶

Add a node with the given parameters to the route. See TPPlusTransitNode.__init__() for parameter info.

getHeadway(indexnum)¶

Returns the float representing the headway, in minutes. indexnum is 1 through 5, an index into the list of time periods

getNumStops()¶

Return the number of stops the route makes

getNumTransitNodes()¶

Return the number of transit nodes in the route

getRouteName()¶
getTransitDelay(nodeId)¶

Return the delay for the transit node with the given id, in minutes.

getTransitNode(nodeId)¶

Return the transit node with the given id; this is an instance of TPPlusTransitNode

hasTransitNode(nodeId)¶

Return True if the route has a node with the given id otherwise false

isFirstNode(nodeId)¶

Return True if the input node id is the first node in the route

isLastNode(nodeId)¶

Return True if the input node id is the last node in the route

iterTransitNodes()¶

Return an iterator to the transit nodes, which are instances of TPPlusTransitNode

iterTransitStops()¶

Iterator for the TPPlusTransitNode instances that are stops.

classmethod read(net, fileName, includeOnlyNetNodes=False)¶
toTransitLine(dtaNetwork, dtaRouteId, MODE_TO_LITYPE, MODE_TO_VTYPE, headwayIndex, startTime, demandDurationInMin, doShortestPath=True, maxShortestPathLen=4)¶

Convert this instance to an equivalent DTA transit line(s). Returns list of instances of TransitLine.

Links on the route are checked against the given dtaNetwork (an instance of Network). If doShortestPath is True, then a shortest path is searched for on the dtaNetwork and that is included (so this is assuming that the calling instance is missing some nodes; this can happen, for example, if the DTA network has split links for centroid connectors, etc.). If doShortestPath is True then any shortest path segments longer than maxShortestPathLen are dropped (e.g. if they’re Light rail segments underground) and a second

Other arguments:

  • dtaRouteId is the id number for the new TransitLine instance.
  • MODE_TO_LITYPE maps the TPPlusTransitRoute.mode attribute (strings) to a line type (either TransitLine.LINE_TYPE_BUS or TransitLine.LINE_TYPE_TRAM)
  • MODE_TO_VTYPE maps the TPPlusTransitRoute.mode attribute (strings) to a VehicleType name
  • headwayIndex is the index into the frequencies to use for the headway (for use with TPPlusTransitRoute.getHeadway())
  • startTime is the start time for the bus line (and instance of Time), and demandDurationInMin is used for calculating the number of transit vehicle departures that will be dispatched.

Note that the start time for the TransitLine instance will be randomized within [startTime, startTime + the headway).
